summary: Louis H. Hindle was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll certifications for the months of February, November, and December of 1977. These documents list his name and salary, confirming his employment with the committee during that period. The documents do not specify his exact role within the HSCA.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Louis H. Hindle's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the investigation of President Kennedy's assassination. However, without further information about his specific role, it is difficult to assess the extent of his contribution to the committee's work.
